WorkItem.Description:
1. Sigils imported from Wowhead are still given the item type "None".
 
2. "Sigil" is not listed as an item type in the drop-down in the Item Editor.  As a result, Sigils imported from Armory show an item type of "Two-Handed Sword".
 
Patch 2862 contains fixes for both of these.  (Ignore the patch for Rawr.Base/Armory.cs since this has been obsoleted.)  If preferred, I can roll a new patch and resubmit.
WorkItem.Summary: Sigil item type still not working correctly

Comments.Message: Sorry, I don't see an edit button...  This is against revision 33947.

Ok... Found the wowhead import issue.  Fixing that.
Now to look for the form issue.

Well, you can patch the raw code or...

In the root directory of the project is FormItemEditor.cs, open in Design view, right-click the item type drop-down, select 'Edit Items', add 'Sigil' in an appropriate place.  (I prefer before 'Totem' so that the relics are in alphabetical order.)  And that should take care of it.

Fixed by:
Completed: At revision: 33959  
both the wowhead import issue as well as the form.
